value.title: Substring in DAX   How to get Part of String Field in Power BI Using DAX Expression
value.excerpt: Substring is one of the most common functions in many languages, However, there is no such function in DAX. There is a very simple way of doing it, which I am going to explain in this post. Substring means getting part of a string, for example from "Reza Rad", if I want to get the start starting from
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WEelCk04dYw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Take Your Power BI Visualization to the Next Level using Small Multiples
value.excerpt: Small multiple is a relatively recent feature on some of the Power BI visuals. This feature enables you to have a much better visualization instead of trying to fit everything in one visual (over-complicate it) or create copies of the same visual (maintenance issue in the future). This is a simple feature
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HFjR--rPUSw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Top Five Mistakes to Avoid When Developing Power BI Reports
value.excerpt: Because Power BI is an easy-to-start platform and you don't need an extensive learning curve to get started with Power BI Desktop, we often see some bad practices in the implementation of Power BI reports. In this article and video, I explained the top five mistakes that I see happen a lot in building

value.title: TOPN DAX Function   How it works in Power BI   Comparison against the top group
value.excerpt: TOPN is a function in DAX that gives you the ability to select the top items from a table based on an expression. In this article and video, I’ll explain how to use the TopN function in DAX either to create a calculated table or to use it in a measure to achieve analysis such as; comparison with the
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FlSpuVKVRmA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Unpivot in Power BI and Power Query Transforming Budget Data from Columns to Rows
value.excerpt: Turning columns to rows or rows to columns is easy with Power Query and Power BI. There are many situations that you get a name, value data source, and wants to convert that into columns with values underneath. On the other hand, many times you get multiple columns and want to change it to name, value

value.title: What are the Use Cases of Dataflow for You in Power BI
value.excerpt: There have been lots of announcements about Dataflow online, through videos and articles and news. There are many demos about Dataflow as well. However, still when I talk about it in conferences, one of the main questions from the audience is that; “What are use cases for it?”. In this video, I’m going

value.title: Working with Records, Lists, and Values in Power BI Dataflows
value.excerpt: If you have been using dataflows, and you have the return value of a query as something which is not in the form of a table, such as a record, list, or value. then you have seen that the dataflow automatically converts them all to tables. There is an explanation about it, and a method around it. In this

value.title: Writing calculations on a real time streaming Power BI dataset using DAX measures
value.excerpt: In the previous article and video, I explained a method that you can use to have real-time calculations in a Power BI streaming dataset. The calculations done that way are limited though because it is using the Q&A feature of Power BI. If you are after a complex calculation then DAX can definitely help.

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Letter case sensitivity in DAX, Power BI and Analysis Services
value.excerpt: Power BI and Analysis Services are case-insensitive by default. Lowercase letters are identical to uppercase letters. This is mostly a good choice, but it also comes with unexpected consequences. In this video, we run through a set of queries to understand what to be aware of when working with a mixture
